---
title: "COVID Restrictions by State"
author: "Zayne Sember"
output: html_notebook
---

```{r, message=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(readxl)
```

```{r}
restrictions <- read_excel("Auxiliary Data/Restrictions/AARP_State_Restrictions_Long.xlsx")

restrictions %>% 
  select(date_3, level_3) %>%
  gather(key=level_3, value=date_3) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=date_3,fill=level_3)) + 
  geom_bar(position="dodge") +
  xlab("") +
  ylab("Frequency") +
  ggtitle("COVID-19 Restriction Level") +
  theme_bw()
```
Throughout the analyzed dates, most states impose restrictions at the state-level, presumably informed by state-level numbers. There is an uptick in states basing restrictions on county numbers.
